Able to update the status of each task
commitResults.messageBody:
The user can type done along with the task number separated by a space to update the status of the task as "done".

Minor changes in the skeleton to suit the changes in this new commit.

Messages will be printed if the task number is invalid or if the input is "list", if there are no tasks in the list

commitResults.messageTitle: Code complies with the given coding standard
Code complies with the given coding standard
commitResults.messageBody:
From this commit onwards, every commit will have a body.

So far, from Level-1 to Level-3, this chatbot creates a list where user can save his tasks and mark "done" if they have completed it. They can also see the list of tasks after increments. Messages will be printed when the user commands the bot to print out a list if there are no tasks or if the task number given by the user to mark as done is out of range.

commitResults.messageTitle: Categorising the tasks into three types
commitResults.messageBody:
Now, there are three different types of tasks: todo, event and deadline. Todo is a type of task with no dates. Event is a type of task which contains the date of the event. Deadline is a type of task containing the date and time of the task deadline.

There is a new command called "help" which prints out all the commands along with its description and format. This is used whenever the user is unsure of any command.

Another change is that leading and trailing spaces of the input command is removed, so that the command is executed though there are additional spaces between the words and at the start of the command.

commitResults.messageTitle: Categorising the tasks into three types
commitResults.messageBody:
The most important change in this commit is that the name of the bot has been changed to Austin for uniqueness.

Now, there are three different types of tasks: todo, event and deadline. Todo is a type of task with no dates. Event is a type of task which contains the date of the event. Deadline is a type of task containing the date and time of the task deadline.

There is a new command called "help" which prints out all the commands along with its description and format. This is used whenever the user is unsure of any command.

Another change is that leading and trailing spaces of the input command is removed, so that the command is executed though there are additional spaces between the words and at the start of the command.

commitResults.messageTitle: Automating the test of the text UIs using I/O redirection technique
commitResults.messageBody:
Added few commands in the input.txt and expected output statements are added in EXPECTED.TXT.

Using runtest.bat, the bot is tested to check whether the outputs match that of in EXPECTED.TXT.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improving the code quality
commitResults.messageBody: Minor errors in the documentation are fixed.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch-Level-5
commitResults.messageBody:
The error handlings are changed to try-catch statements to make the error handling easier. This is done by creating new exception class called AustinException, which is thrown when the command is invalid or when the format of the command is incorrect.

The format for event and deadline commands are changed, so that it will be easier to type in. Instead of "/by" and "/at", "|" symbol is used to differentiate between the task description and date and time information.

Some of the methods in Duke class are changed to private because they modify the list which is a private attribute. This improves the encapsulation.

The code is more abstract as the main function contains only the commands. This is done by creating two new functions processCommand() and addTask().

commitResults.messageTitle: Adding all the classes into a new package
Removing imports which are not used
Changing the code structure to make sure each line does not exceed 90 characters
Adding a delete function
commitResults.messageBody: You can use the "delete" function to remove tasks in the list. This is done by using "remove" method from the ArrayList library.

commitResults.messageTitle: Storing the tasks in the text file
commitResults.messageBody:
The task files are now stored in the text file so that they can still be accessed in future program runs.

There is a new function called "clear" which removes all the tasks from array and in the file. This makes it more efficient than removing every task using "delete" command.

Task has become an abstract class because it is easier to implement the new function called "toFileFormat".

commitResults.messageTitle: Fixing some minor errors
Refactored the code into many classes
commitResults.messageBody:
New packages have been created to split class based on their purpose.

'undo' command is introduced in this commit to uncheck the task. For instance, if the user has marked the wrong task as "done", this command can be used to revert it.

Newer exceptions have been created to print different message for different errors easier.

commitResults.messageTitle: Adding date and time features to event and deadline
Adding "agenda" command
commitResults.messageBody: This allows the users to find out the deadlines due today and events happening today.

commitResults.messageTitle: Minor errors fixed
Adding "find" command to help users to search for tasks which matches with the keyword.
Adding documentation
